alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 08 at 7:32PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West-southwest winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 70 mph possible, especially in wind-prone areas including Highway 95 near Walker Lake. * WHERE...Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Blowing dust may reduce visibility downwind of dry lake beds and sinks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North to south oriented highways will experience the strongest crosswinds. Areas of blowing dust will be possible. Gusty winds and dry conditions may result in a period of localized critical fire conditions, so avoid activities that may spark a fire.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.
